column1: ...Lake Oroville is a reservoir formed by the Oroville Dam impounding the Feather River, located in Butte County  , northern California.  The lake is situated northeast of the city of Oroville , within the Lake Oroville State Recreation Area, in the western foothills of the Sierra Nevada .  Known as the second-largest reservoir in California, Lake Oroville is treated as a keystone facility within the California State Wate...

...whole.  The Feather River and its forks were a rich center of gold mining during the 19th century.  Since the 1960s, the river has provided water to central and southern California, as the main source of water for the California State Water Project.  Its water is also used for hydroelectricity generation. The Feather is unique in that two of its tributaries, the North Fork and Middle Fork, originate east of the Sierra Nevada in the Diamond Mountains  and breach the crest of the Sierras as they flow west.
Course The river rises in four main forks in the Sierr...

...te east of the Sierra Nevada in the Diamond Mountains  and breach the crest of the Sierras as they flow west.
Course The river rises in four main forks in the Sierra Nevada which unite as arms of the Lake Oroville reservoir in the foothills northeast of Oroville  in eastern Butte County .  In terms of drainage areas the largest is the North Fork, which drains about 60% of the entire upper Feather River watershed.  The Middle Fork is the second largest, draining about 32% of the upper basin.  The South...

Known as the second-largest reservoir in California, Lake Oroville is treated as a keystone facility within the California State Water Project by storing water, providing flood control, recreation, freshwater releases assist in controlling the salinity intrusion Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta and protecting fish and wildlife. The lake is a popular nationally renowned bass fishing location, while coho salmon are stocked from the Feather River Fish Hatchery.  This hatchery is a main component of Lake Oroville...
